content: I'm altering exposed filters using hook_views_pre_build() but when I filter the view, using AJAX, my alterations from the pre_build hook no longer work. Any ideas on a hook I should to alter exposed filters that works both on initial page load and after an AJAX filter is applied? (btw: form alter doesn't seem to work as it should in my case)

Views has loads of hooks... That can be tricky. Exposed forms usually work via GET params, that might be the problem here - not sure. Do you have to alter the query? Maybe someone comes with a fancy idea, if you describe your use-case a bit.

The api page - to pick a hook :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: https://docs.backdropcms.org/api/backdrop/core!modules!views!views.api.php

hook_views_ajax_data_alter?
Thanks for the input...yeah, I tried lots of different views hooks, I figured pre_build would work best because it's super-early in the process...but no go. I'll keep plugging away on it today :)
Can you describe a bit, what you're trying to achieve? If you want to change the filtered result (result list), you might need to alter the query.

I'm giving authors an option, on a node form, for which views filters they want displayed in the view which gets embedded on the node page. So we have 4 available filters, they choose which ones display...then I hide some filters based on their selection. So it's potentially a different set of filters on each node display (did that make sense?)

I tried doing it during a form_alter, which should work...but for some reason setting #access on the form fields (to hide them) still left the html and label in place. So I moved to a views hook instead, which works perfectly...unless AJAX is on. Then the ajax-flitered page ignores my alterations.
I looked into altering the query...but I couldn't find a working way to alter which filters display at that stage.
Ah, OK, that's something totally different than I had in mind... seems tricky.
Yeah, i'm just stumped as to why the AJAX filtered result would ignore the views hook...seems like it should be going thru the same process.

In the end, I may have to do what I dont want to do: Just add classes into my theme dynamically and use those to hide certain filters. I hate that option, but can't seem to find another way to accomplish this.
How are you embedding the views? Which module are you using?
I didn't think of that...i suppose i could try some different embed methods and see if it makes a difference
Ohhhhhh....that made a difference! If I just embed the view directly, it works! Thanks for the idea @indigoxela !!
I didn't do anything besides head scratching. :smile_cat: Glad that it works now.
I work by myself (and have for the last 15 years)...so someone else doing some head-scratching out loud can make all the difference!
Yay teamwork! :smile: :love:
